fields.headline: Leicester v Arsenal: match preview
fields.bodyText: The contrast between these clubs goes way beyond a six-point gap in the table. Arsenal are close to disarray, with a woeful away record, a dispute over the captaincy and doubts about the future of Unai Emery. At Leicester, harmony reigns and Brendan Rodgers is bringing the best out of an exciting young team. Rodgers says it is far too early to talk about a top-four finish but a win would increase those prospects and pile pressure on Emery. Paul Doyle Saturday 5.30pm Sky Sports Premier League Venue King Power Stadium Last season Leicester 3 Arsenal 0 Referee Chris Kavanagh This season G8 Y31 R0 3.88 cards/game Odds H 11-10 A 5-2 D 11-4 LEICESTER Subs from Ward, Jakupovic, Fuchs, Morgan, Albrighton, Praet, Gray, Iheanacho, Amartey, Choudhury, Mendy, Benkovic Doubtful None Injured James (achilles, unknown) Suspended None Discipline Y11 R0 Form WWLWWW Leading scorer Vardy 10 ARSENAL Subs from Martínez, Macey, Maitland-Niles Holding, Mustafi, Chambers, Mavropanos, Kolasinac, Xhaka, Smith Rowe, Martinelli, Pépé, Nelson, Saka, John-Jules, Medley, Burton Doubtful None Injured Ceballos (hamstring, 23 Nov) Suspended None Discipline Y26 R1 Form WDWLDD Leading scorer Aubameyang 8
